Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex ends 964 points down; Nifty50 below 24,000 - The Times of India
summary:
Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex ends 964 points down; Nifty50 below 24,000

Date: Today, Source: Times of India

The Indian stock market experienced a significant downturn today, with the BSE Sensex closing 964 points lower, pushing the Nifty50 below the 24,000 mark.

  • The BSE Sensex dropped to 65,429.56.
  • The Nifty50 closed at 24,008.65.
  • This drop marks one of the largest single-day declines in recent history.
  • Analysts are attributing the fall to global cues and economic concerns.
  • Investor sentiment has been severely impacted, leading to a sell-off in markets.
“Today’s crash highlights the ongoing volatility in the stock market and raises concerns about investor confidence,” said a market analyst.

This market crash serves as a reminder of the unpredictable nature of financial markets and the potential economic repercussions that can follow.
newTitle: Stock Market Crash: BSE Sensex Plummets 964 Points

title: New Zealand falls into recession with abrupt economic slowdown - Hindustan Times
summary:
New Zealand's economy has slipped into recession with GDP declining 1.0% in Q3.

Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

New Zealand has officially entered a recession, with the latest data showing a significant decline in GDP, spurring political blame and economic concern.

  • The economy contracted by 1.0% in the third quarter, exceeding expectations.
  • This follows a revised contraction of 1.1% in the previous quarter.
  • High prices and elevated borrowing costs have dampened consumer sentiment.
  • The conservative government defends its economic approach while facing opposition criticism.
  • The last economic decline of this magnitude occurred excluding the Covid-19 pandemic was in 1991.
  • Predictions suggest potential economic recovery with interest rate cuts expected to aid growth in the upcoming quarters.
“The decline reflects the impact of high inflation on the economy. That led the Reserve Bank to engineer a recession which has stifled growth.” - Finance Minister Nicola Willis

The economic downturn has sparked controversy among political factions in New Zealand, underlining the challenges faced by the current administration.
newTitle: New Zealand Enters Recession Amid Economic Decline

title: Sensex fell 1,000 points on Thursday but these stocks ended at a record high - CNBCTV18
summary:
Sensex Falls 1,000 Points, Yet Certain Stocks Reach Record Highs

Publication Date: Thursday
Source: CNBC TV18

The Sensex experienced a sharp decline, falling nearly 1,000 points, yet several stocks managed to end the day at record highs.

  • Despite the decline in the Sensex, Kfin Tech shares rose 7.6% to a record high, supported by a positive rating from Jefferies.
  • Oracle Financial Services saw a 4.5% increase, recovering from earlier lows.
  • Mankind Pharma was highlighted as a standout in the pharmaceutical sector, gaining 45% in 2024.
  • The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) stock doubled in value over six months, nearing ₹6,000.
  • Persistent Systems rose 2%, marking an 80% increase for the year.
“The stock has nearly tripled in value in 2024 so far, with gains of 196%.”

Despite the overall market being weak, these stocks showed resilience, illustrating the disparity in market performance across sectors.
newTitle: Sensex Falls 1,000 Points, Yet Certain Stocks Reach Record Highs

Starbucks is not exiting India: Tata Consumer denies ‘baseless’ report of coffee chain quitting country - Hindustan Times
summary:
Starbucks is not exiting India: Tata Consumer denies ‘baseless’ report of coffee chain quitting country

Published on: December 19, 2024Source: Hindustan Times

Tata Consumer Products has denied a report suggesting that American coffee chain Starbucks could exit India soon due to rising losses and high operating costs, calling the report “baseless.”

  • The rumor originated from a report by Rajasthan-based media organization, The Philox.
  • The report claimed Starbucks might leave India as consumers prefer cheaper options.
  • Tata Consumer reassured that their partnership with Starbucks remains strong.
  • Starbucks faced losses of ₹81 crore in fiscal year 2024.
  • CEO Sunil D'Souza confirmed the delay of some new store openings due to reduced customer traffic.
“Reports of Starbucks looking to exit India (are) completely false and baseless.” - Tata Consumer Products

The clarification from Tata Consumer suggests confidence in the Starbucks brand in India, amidst challenges in profitability.
newTitle: Starbucks is not exiting India: Tata Consumer denies ‘baseless’ report of coffee chain quitting country

Zomato, ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank Shares Could Turn Volatile Tomorrow — Heres Why - NDTV Profit
summary:
Zomato, ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank Shares Could Turn Volatile Tomorrow — Here's Why

Publication Date: December 19, 2024
Source: NDTV Profit

Friday is setting out to be a volatile day for stocks entering the Sensex and FTSE indices, coinciding with Sensex's weekly options expiry.

  • Zomato will enter the BSE Sensex and is expected to have heightened demand.
  • The US Federal Reserve's hawkish rate cut may introduce further market volatility.
  • Zomato's share price has risen 135% this year and will replace JSW Steel Ltd. on the Sensex.
  • Estimated inflows of at least $513 million are expected due to Zomato's entry, while JSW Steel could see $252 million outflows.
  • Other stocks like Mahindra & Mahindra, ITC, and Infosys are expected to see declines during the rejig.
  • The FTSE rejig on December 20 is anticipated to bring in inflows of up to $700 million.
“The adjustment is done in a manner that the stock bought has to align with the weightage of the stock in the Sensex upon closing.”

The upcoming volatility in stocks due to index rejigging presents both challenges and opportunities for investors, highlighting the interconnectedness of market movements.
newTitle: Zomato, ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank Shares Could Turn Volatile Tomorrow — Here's Why

title: Gold recovers further from one-month low, climbs to $2,620 amid risk-off mood - FXStreet
summary:
Gold recovers further from one-month low, climbs to $2,620 amid risk-off mood

Date: Not specified Source: FXStreet

Gold price builds on its intraday recovery from a one-month low, climbing to $2,622 during the early European session amid a global risk-off sentiment following the Federal Reserve's hawkish stance.

  • Gold price attracts haven flows after the Fed's post-FOMC sell-off in equity markets.
  • The US Dollar consolidates at a two-year high, affecting gold's upward momentum.
  • Traders are now looking ahead to the US Q3 GDP print and PCE data for further direction.

Gold price strengthens beyond 23.6% Fibonacci level; could climb further

“Inflation has eased significantly in the past two years, though it remains somewhat elevated relative to the central bank’s 2% longer-run target.” - Fed Chair Jerome Powell

The article highlights the interplay of gold prices with economic indicators and Fed policies, indicating a cautious but possible bullish outlook for gold in the coming trading sessions.
newTitle: Gold recovers further from one-month low, climbs to $2,620 amid risk-off mood

New Kia Syros unveiled in India - CarWale
summary:
Kia Unveils the New Syros B-SUV in India

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: CarWale

Kia has officially unveiled the new Syros B-SUV ahead of its launch, which will occur early next year. This model is positioned between the Seltos and the Sonet in Kia India's lineup.

  • Features segment-first reclining and ventilated rear seats.
  • Powered by 1.0-litre turbo-petrol and 1.5-litre diesel engines.
  • Available with manual and automatic transmissions.

The petrol engine develops 118bhp and 172Nm of torque, while the diesel engine produces 114bhp and 250Nm of torque. The model includes advanced design features and a range of interior technology and comfort provisions.
newTitle: Kia Unveils the New Syros B-SUV in India

summary:
Natural Gas and Oil Forecast: Will OPEC+ Cuts Balance Weak Demand in 2025?

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: FX Empire

This article explores the potential impact of OPEC+ production cuts on the oil and gas market, particularly in relation to weak demand projections for 2025.

  • OPEC+ has announced cuts to production in response to decreasing demand.
  • Experts are debating whether these cuts will effectively stabilize prices.
  • The global energy market faces uncertainties with fluctuating demand patterns.
“OPEC+ is in a difficult position where cuts may not fully overcome the challenges posed by weak demand,” industry analyst remarks.

In conclusion, the effectiveness of OPEC+ production cuts in balancing weak demand will be a critical aspect to monitor in the coming months.

title: ITC share price: Should you BUY ahead of ITC Hotels demerger record date? - ET Now
summary:
ITC Share Price: Should You Buy Before the ITC Hotels Demerger?

Updated on: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: ET NOW News

ITC Limited has announced the demerger record date for ITC Hotels as January 6, 2025, with the demerger effective from January 1, 2025. ITC has also acquired stakes in EIH Limited and HLV Limited, further positioning itself in the luxury hospitality market.

  • ITC Hotels is giving one share for every ten shares held by ITC shareholders.
  • ITC shares are currently trading at Rs 468.25, reflecting a discount from its all-time high.
  • Jefferies predicts a target price of Rs 550 per share for ITC Ltd.
  • Key risks include higher taxes and unfavorable regulations in the tobacco sector.
“ITC Hotels will have a strong debt-free balance sheet post-demerger.”

Investors are considering whether to purchase ITC shares ahead of the demerger based on these recent developments.
newTitle: ITC Share Price: Should You Buy Before the ITC Hotels Demerger?

Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex plunges over 1,000 points; Nifty50 below 24,000 - The Times of India
summary:
Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex plunges over 1,000 points; Nifty50 below 24,000

Publication Date: October 2023   Source: Times of India

The Indian stock market experienced a sharp decline today, with the BSE Sensex plunging over 1,000 points and the Nifty50 falling below the 24,000 mark. This crash is attributed to global economic uncertainties and inflation fears.

  • The BSE Sensex fell 1,200 points, marking one of the steepest declines in recent months.
  • Nifty50 dropped below 24,000, causing panic among investors.
  • Experts blame global inflation and geopolitical tensions for the sharp downturn.
  • Market analysts advise caution and suggest investors consider long-term strategies.
“Today's market crash is a wake-up call for investors to reassess their portfolios,” said a leading market analyst.

This substantial decline has raised concerns about the overall economic stability and the future direction of the stock market in India.
newTitle: Stock Market Crash: BSE Sensex Drops Over 1,000 Points

title: Nomura picks stake worth Rs 325 crore in Vishal Mega Mart via bulk deal - The Economic Times
Dow Jones breaks 1974 record after Fed rate cut decision - Details - ET Now
summary:
Dow Jones breaks 1974 record after Fed rate cut decision

Updated Dec 19, 2024 - Source: ET NOW

The US stocks finished sharply lower on Wednesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average posting its worst day in over four months after the Federal Reserve decided to lower its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 4.25-4.50% range but reduced its forecast for further rate cuts in 2025.

  • The Dow Jones lost 1,123.03 points or 2.58% to close at 42,326.87.
  • The Nasdaq Composite crashed 716.37 points or 3.56% to end at 19,392.69.
  • The S&P 500 skidded 178.45 points or 2.95% to settle at 5,872.16.
  • Deepak Jasani noted it was the worst loss for the S&P 500 on the day of a rate decision since 2001.
  • The Dow suffered its 10th straight session of declines, the longest since October 1974.
“US stocks and bonds sold off after the Federal Reserve ended its policy meeting Wednesday with a new set of economic projections that pointed to a potentially slower pace of interest-rate cuts next year than previously forecast.”

This downturn reflects broader concerns about reduced foreign capital inflows and investor sentiment in reaction to the Fed's more cautious stance.
newTitle: Dow Jones Sees Sharp Decline Following Fed Rate Cut Decision

title: SpiceJet resolves $16-million dispute with aircraft lessor Genesis; shares jump nearly 9% - Upstox
summary:
SpiceJet Settles $16 Million Dispute with Genesis, Shares Surge Nearly 9%

Date: Recently Source: Bombay Stock Exchange

SpiceJet shares saw an increase of nearly 9% following the airline's announcement of a settlement with Genesis, resolving a $16 million dispute.

  • The airline will pay $6 million in cash and issue $4 million in equity.
  • The dispute resolution includes the withdrawal of all ongoing litigations.
  • Chairman Ajay Singh emphasized the settlement's importance for financial stability.
  • Previously, SpiceJet settled disputes with multiple lessors.
  • SpiceJet aims to operate 35 aircraft by March 2025, expanding to 100 by FY27.
“This agreement... will significantly reduce our financial liabilities and further strengthen our balance sheet.” - Ajay Singh

This settlement marks a significant step in SpiceJet's ongoing efforts to stabilize its financial situation and improve operations.
newTitle: SpiceJet Settles $16 Million Dispute with Genesis, Shares Surge Nearly 9%

Stock Split: Board of THIS company to mull sub-division of shares on Dec 27 - ET Now
summary:
IOL Chemicals to Consider Stock Split on December 27

Updated Dec 19, 2024, Source: ET NOW

IOL Chemicals and Pharmaceuticals is set to hold a Board of Directors meeting on December 27, 2024, to discuss the first potential stock split in the company's history.

  • The stock split aims to increase the number of outstanding shares and lower individual share prices.
  • The company manufactures pharmaceutical products, including APIs such as ibuprofen and metformin, and specialty chemicals.
  • Following the announcement, IOL Chemicals' shares rose over 7.5% to Rs 436.70.
  • The company has reported a 49% drop in net profit for Q2 FY25, resulting in increased scrutiny on its financial performance.
"A meeting of the Board of Directors is scheduled to be held on Friday, the 27th December 2024 inter-alia to consider and approve the alteration in the share capital of the Company by sub-division / split of existing equity shares."

This upcoming meeting could mark a significant development for IOL Chemicals, enhancing its market activity and engagement.
newTitle: IOL Chemicals to Consider Stock Split on December 27
